item.title:
RT by @juliacraven: I also want to add that I’m still really glad I was masked.
Viral load matters for severity of sickness and I imagine I’d be feeling a whole lot worse if I hadn’t been masked for the entirety of my exposure.
item.dc:creator: @NBedera
item.description:
I also want to add that I’m still really glad I was masked.

Viral load matters for severity of sickness and I imagine I’d be feeling a whole lot worse if I hadn’t been masked for the entirety of my exposure.

item.title:
RT by @juliacraven: I got COVID. While wearing an N95 on a plane.
When I tell people, they respond with some version of, “That’s unfair! You’re more careful than anyone I know!”
And all I can think is, “Yeah. And I’ve been screaming from the rooftops that ‘individual responsibility’ isn’t enough.”
item.dc:creator: @NBedera
item.description:
I got COVID. While wearing an N95 on a plane.

When I tell people, they respond with some version of, “That’s unfair! You’re more careful than anyone I know!”

And all I can think is, “Yeah. And I’ve been screaming from the rooftops that ‘individual responsibility’ isn’t enough.”

item.title:
RT by @juliacraven: sharing this as @scalawagmag enters its annual two-week (paid) staff-wide summer pause.
yes the world is crumbling. yes we’re logging off because rest is a practice. yes, your workplace can try the same and you’ll be ok.
see y’all mid-July 🏝
https://www.teenvogue.com/story/month-paid-leave-work

item.title: RT by @juliacraven: i actually don’t subscribe to the term food desert because it is too passive about how grocery stores refuse to ppe locations in Black and brown neighborhoods; it is active and systematic. a more accurate expression is food apartheid. https://www.theatlantic.com/national/archive/2014/02/trader-joes-racism-scandal-no-one-talking-about/357969/
item.dc:creator: @lexicon91
item.description: i actually don’t subscribe to the term food desert because it is too passive about how grocery stores refuse to ppe locations in Black and brown neighborhoods; it is active and systematic. a more accurate expression is food apartheid. theatlantic.com/national/arc…
